description: This course provides an overview of the major thinkers who sought to create a science of human
society, the ideas they found fundamental to a science of society and how human society changes
through history. Classical thinkers such as Marx, Durkheim, Simmel, Weber, and Mead are studied
along with the schools of theory which they inspired: positivism, interpretive and critical
conflict theory.  Open to sociology/anthropology majors only.  Prerequisite: one
sociology/anthropology course.  Offered annually in the spring semester.
